contestants.title: Fingerless gloves
contestants.author: user1
contestants.text:
Image and pattern from A pile of sheep.

Size: To fit an average women’s size hand (7.5” around the knuckles).

MATERIALS

Yarn Requirements: DK weight yarn with good stretch and a bit of texture, preferably wool mix. 135yds in MC, 70yds in CC.

Needles: 1 set of 4mm dpns

Gauge: 28st/ 29 rws to 4in (10cm) in Houndstooth pattern.

Also required: 2 stitch markers, stitch holder/waste yarn.

DIRECTIONS
RIGHT MITT
Cuff

CO 44 in MC, using either long-tail cast on or 1x1 ribbed tubular cast on.
Divide sts evenly across needles. Carefully join without twisting to start working in the round.
Round 1: [K1, P1] to end of round.
Repeat this round until you have worked 20 rounds in total.

Hand

The four following rounds make up one repeat of the Houndstooth pattern. All pattern stitches are K, unless stated otherwise. When changing between yarns, always carry the CC yarn under the MC.
Round A: [3CC, 1MC] to end.
Round B: [1CC, 3MC] to end.
Round C: 1MC, [1CC, 3MC] x10, 1CC, 2MC
Round D: 2CC, [1MC, 3CC] x10, 1MC, 1CC
Join on CC yarn.
Round 1: As Round A of Houndstooth pattern
Round 2: Sl, [3MC, 1CC] x10, 3MC (As Round B of Houndstooth pattern)
Rounds 3 & 4: As Rounds C and D of pattern.

Thumb gusset
Round 5: (Work pattern as for Round 1) K22, place marker, K1, place marker, K to end of round.
Round 6: (Continuing to repeat Houndstooth pattern) K to marker, sl marker, work row 1 of Thumb Gusset chart, sl marker, K to end of round.
Rounds 7-31: Continue to work Houndstooth pattern over the main body of the hand, and the Thumb Gusset chart between the markers, until row 25 of the chart has been reached.
Round 32: K in pattern to marker, remove marker, sl19 onto holder/ waste yarn, remove marker, CO 1 in MC, K in pattern to end of round.
Work 7 more rounds of Houndstooth pattern, or until the mitt reaches your finger knuckles.

Ribbing
In MC only:
Round 1: [K1, P1] to end of round
Round 2: sl, [P1, K1] to last stitch, P1
Rounds 3-8: [K1, P1] to end of round
BO all stitches loosely in either 1x1 (K1, P1) rib or tubular cast off.

Thumb
Move all held stitches back onto needles. Divide sts across your needles and mark the beginning of the round.
Join on MC yarn.
Round 1: [P1, K1] x9, P1, then pick up and K 3 sts over the open edge of the hand.
Round 2: [P1, K1] x9, P1, sk2p.
Rounds 3-6: [P1, K1] to end of round.
BO all stitches loosely in 1x1 (P1, K1) rib or tubular cast off

LEFT MITT

Follow instructions for right mitt again.

Finishing

Weave in all ends. Block mitts by washing in lukewarm water, squeezing out excess water in a towel, and laying flat to dry.

winners.title: Messenger bag
winners.author: user1
winners.text:
Pattern and image from All Free Knitting.

Knitting Needle Size: 7 or 4.5 mm

Yarn Weight: Medium Weight/Worsted Weight and Aran (16-20 stitches to 4 inches)

Gauge: 16 sts x 20 rows = 4" (10.2cm) in St st. Save time, check your gauge!

Finished Size: 10" x 10" (25cm x 25cm) folded

MATERIALS
  • Willow Meadow (100% cotton; 50g/103yd) yarn:
    • 731937-0033 Dark Cherry (3 balls): A
    • 731937- 0031 Windstorm (1 ball): B
    • 731937-0032 Pines (1 ball): C
    • 731937-0027 Bark (1 ball): D
  • US size 7 (4.5mm) straight needles or size needed to obtain gauge
  • Cable needle
  • Stitch marker
  • Yarn needle
DIRECTIONS
Bag

Using A, CO 40 sts.
Rows 1-8: K.
Cut A at end of Row 8.
Row 9 (RS): With B, k.
Row 10: K4, p to last 4 sts, k4.
Rows 11-16: Rep last 2 rows 3 more times.
Cut B at end of Row 16.
Rows 17-24: With C, rep Rows 9-10.
Cut C at end of Row 24.
Rows 25-32: With D, rep Rows 9-10.
Cut D at end of Row 32.
Rows 33-40: With A, rep Rows 9-10.
Cut A at end of Row 40.
Rows 41-48: With B, rep Rows 9-10.
Cut B at end of Row 48.
Rows 49-56: With C, rep Rows 9-10.
Cut C at end of Row 56.
Rows 57-64: With D, rep Rows 9-10.
Cut D at end of Row 64.
Rows 65-66: *With A, k 2 rows.
Row 67 (RS): K.
Row 68: K4, p to last 4 sts, k4.

Cont to work with A, rep Rows 67-68, for another 10" (25cm).

Rep from * 3 more times except on last rep work for only 9" (22.9cm).
K 8 rows.
BO.

Assembly

Fold 5 sections of purse accordion style so that stripe section becomes the flap and BO edge is at the top front under the flap. Sew through all 4 layers of each edge to make side seams, leaving flap free. Weave in all ends.

Strap

Using A, CO 120 sts.
K 10 rows.
BO.
Sew ends to sides of bag.

winners.title: Angled eyelets blanket
winners.author: user1
winners.text:
Pattern and image from Joann's.

MATERIALS

5 balls Bernat Blanket (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Dark Grey

Size U.S. 11 (8 mm) circular knitting needle 36" long or size needed to obtain gauge

MEASUREMENTS: Approx 52" x 59".

GAUGE: 8 sts and 13 rows = 4" in stocking st.

DIRECTIONS

Cast on 1/4 sts. Do not join.
Working back and forth across needle, knit 3 rows (garter st), noting first row is WS.
Proceed in pat as follows:
Row 1: (RS). K7. *K2tog. yo. K9. Rep from * 7 times more. K2tog. yo. K7.
Rows 2 and alt: K2. Purl to last 2 sts. K2.
Row 3: K6. *(K2tog. yo) twice. K7. Rep from * 7 times more. (K2tog. yo) twice. K6.
Row 5: K5. *(K2tog. yo) 3 times. K5. Rep from * 7 times more. (K2tog. yo) 3 times. K5.
Row 7: K4. *(K2tog. yo) 4 times. K3. Rep from * 7 times more. (K2tog. yo) 4 times. K4.
Row 9: K3. *(K2tog. yo) 5 times. K1. Rep from * 7 times more. (K2tog. yo) 5 times. K3.
Row 11: As 7th row.
Row 13: As 5th row.
Row 15: As 3rd row.
Row 16: As 2nd row.
These 16 rows form Crystal Lace Pat.
Cont in pat until Blanket from beg measures approx 57", ending on a 16th row of pat.
Knit 3 rows (garter st). Cast off knitwise (WS).
